metadata.name: Remote Access Tool - AnyDesk Piped Password Via CLI
metadata.comment: Detects piping the password to an anydesk instance via CMD and the '--set-password' flag.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('/c ')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('echo ')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('.exe --set-password')))

output.summary: Detects piping the password to an anydesk instance via CMD and the '--set-password' flag.

metadata.objective: False positives: 1. Legitimate piping of the password to anydesk 2. Some FP could occur with similar tools that uses the same command line '--set-password' Reference: https://redcanary.com/blog/misbehaving-rats/
